Fields.DialogueText: Achilles, might I have a word with you?
For you, Captain, I'll give you as many words as you wish.
Feeling awful confident after your victory, are you?
Confidence is my default, Captain. So what was it you needed?

Fields.MenuText: I wanted to know if you thought you really did your best during the contest.
I wanted to... no, never mind, I'm sure you did everything you could.
I wanted to throw down a new challenge, but I'm not sure you're up to it.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I thought I had, but clearly you have a different opinion.
Wait, what? You don't get to just drop that on me and leave!
Just tell me! Whatever it is, I'm up to it.
I've reviewed the shot percentages from the contest and discovered...
All hands, all hands, Morgana ships inbound. Prepare for battle!
We'll pick this up later, then.
But Captain, I...
I said later, Achilles. This is more important. Get to your post!
@BATTLE
Achilles, are you ready for the bad news?
What bad news?
About the competition.
That's over. I won. What more is there?
Well, there's how you won.
Are you saying I cheated?!?!

Fields.MenuText: You sound strangely guilty there, Achilles.
Well, now that you bring it up...
No, no, not remotely. I swear, your boldness is going to get you into trouble...

Fields.DialogueText: You sound strangely accusatory, Captain.
How about I bring up my fist?
You don't seem to mind it when we're in battle!
Yes, well, I... look, I only wanted to talk about your shot percentage, not get into a fight over anything!
You couldn't have led with that?
Seriously, Achilles, we have got to find a better way to communicate. I can't stumble through these conversations wondering where the next mine is hidden!
Maybe if you had an ounce of my boldness it wouldn't be an issue!
Morganas on the move, Captain!
Good enough for me. Achilles, we'll pick this up later... if you think we can talk like adults.
@BATTLE
So, Captain, you wanted to talk about my shot percentage during the contest?
If you're ready to hear some hard truths.
I'm not sure what you mean by hard truths, but I'm a big girl... so to speak.
All right, then. What I mean is that when I crunched the numbers, I noticed that your ratio of hits to misses was lower when shooting into Morgana mist than from it.
That doesn't sound unique to me. Wouldn't anyone's accuracy fall in the presence of interference?
Apparently not. That's something I think we should address.
But I was still the best, so what's the point?

Fields.MenuText: Knowing you, I figure you'd like to be better.
A contest isn't everything, you know.
And if this war were just a contest, I'm sure we could all go home.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I can't deny that.
Isn't that what losers usually say?
Those of us that have homes, that is.
Hostiles inbound, dead ahead!
I can see this is going to require more discussion. We'll catch up on this some time later.
@BATTLE
And that's why we need to work on your targeting when going from out of the mist!
Not something we can exactly practice, is it? How often do we even encounter the mist?
If I can notice this, it's only a matter of time until the Morganas notice it, too... and try to take advantage of it.
How could they possibly take advantage of something like that? We'd see it all the time if they could.

Fields.MenuText: If they control their mist, they control when it appears...
If they were to feign a retreat and pull their mist with them...
If an order came for a fighting retreat...

Fields.DialogueText: ... and when it disappears.
... I could be suddenly outside the covered zone.
... then I might actually be a hindrance instead of a hero.
Exactly.
When you put it like that, it sounds like something I should work on.
Hope for the best, prepare for the worst. We'll start on it...
Morgana mist spotted off the port!
... now, it seems. Come on, Achilles, let's not keep our Morganas waiting!
@BATTLE
Care to explain what that was?
It's called shooting, Captain.
My coffee maker shoots better than that on a bad day, Achilles!
Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Relax, Achilles. I know you work better when fueled by competition.
At ease, Achilles. I'm just taking your measure.
I hope you don't fold that easily on the field, Achilles!

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, I see. Very well, challenge accepted!
And finding me wanting, it seems!
I haven't failed you yet, Captain!
You're letting your stage fright get to you. Whatever it takes, we're going to get your shots up to par.
Stage fright? As if all these battles were a rehearsal?
@BATTLE
Fair enough. Let's get to work.
As long as it doesn't take insulting me to death, I'll allow it.
For the plausible worst-case scenario, yes. These Morganas are only going to get more powerful, and you need to match them.
So, Captain, can I assume you have a plan?
Regarding your shot percentage? Of course. I mean, mostly, yes.
Either you have one or you don't. There's no real in between.
This isn't like pregnancy, you know. There are degrees of separation.
Oh, and NOW you're bringing up the fact that I can't have children?

Fields.MenuText: What? How do you get that from what I said?
No, see, that's not even close to what I was talking about.
You're just jerking my chain now, right?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha, now you know how it feels to be insulted!
Of course not. I just wanted you to see how it felt to be blindsided.
Grr... you got me. It's just that you hit me with the shot thing and I...
Incoming Morganas. All hands on deck!
Tell you what, Captain, can we just pretend this never happened?
Best thing I've heard all day. Let's get to it.
@BATTLE
So here's my plan.
I'm all ears.
Since your trouble seems come from the difficulty in seeing out of the mist, we...
Begging your pardon, but that's not the trouble at all, Captain.
Excuse me?
That's not the trouble. I can see just as well... um, well, nearly as well. There's not much difference between in and out of the mist in terms of my sight.
Which is a really long winded way of saying what, exactly?
That the problem isn't with my sight.

Fields.MenuText: So what is it with, then? Your head?
So what is it with, then? Your heart?
So what is it with, then? Your trigger?

Fields.DialogueText: Got it in one, Captain.
No, not my heart... not exactly, that is. It's my head.
No, not my trigger... that works as well as ever. It's my head.
Like... a crisis of confidence? You?
Radio intercept, Captain. Morganas approaching.
Well, at least we have somewhere to start now. We'll pick this up again soon.
@BATTLE
I wouldn't characterize it as such, but-
So you say that your head is the problem with your shots, but I have to admit that I don't really get what that means.
It's hard for me to explain as well, but I'll do my best.
Take your time.
Put simply, there's something about the mist itself that... I don't know if I'm saying this right... creeps me out? Like it brings back bad memories I didn't know I had, if that makes sense.
Not really. Keep going.
There's not much more to say about it. I just tense up when I'm in the mist, is all.
But it doesn't affect your shots on things in the mist when you're there too.
I know. I can't explain it, it just is.

Fields.MenuText: So put simply, you're crazy?
So you're saying you can't put your finger on why, but you can identify the where?
Well, at least you're honest about your problem.

Fields.DialogueText: Not any more than the rest of us, you included!
It sounds strange when you say it like that, but I can't disagree.
I feel I have to be if I want to get it fixed.
All right. We'll just have to deal with it as it is and see if we can stumble across an answer. Let's take a break while I think about this a bit.
@BATTLE
The Morganas won't give us much of a break, so do think about it quickly.
All right, let's work on the practical part of the solution and leave the theory for later.
What theory? Oh, the one about why I can't shoot well out of Morgana mist?
That's the one. For now, I've developed an exercise that will give us a sort of baseline on the issue.
Baseline? I thought we had that from your contest.
Whose contest?
Touché. Go on.
This is a different baseline. I want to see how you do against dummy targets.
So that's why you had the crew lay out those buoys?
Precisely. You're going to use those as target practice.
But what about the mist?
That's why I want you to stand in this tub of hot water - I know you can stand here without getting hurt - and we'll fill it with dry ice.
Do you really think that will work?

Fields.MenuText: Do you have a better idea?
Of course I do. That's why I suggested it.
No, but we have to do something.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... not at the moment, no.
All right then, if you think it will work...
Not quite encouraging, Captain, but it is what it is.
So let's begin. Sailors, if you would be so kind as to bring out the water and the ice...
@BATTLE
Wait! Stop!
Is it burning? Is it freezing?
Nothing like that, Captain. We've got Morganas incoming!
Are those my results from the tests?
The first and second test, yes, but I'm still waiting on the results from the third before compiling everything.
Grr... why is it taking so long?

Fields.MenuText: Well if you'd stop bugging the navigator about it, you'd get your answers more quickly.
Because good work takes time, and bad work gets you killed.
Because it does, that's why!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I just want to know!
Waiting is going to kill me first, you know!
I know, I know!
So take this as my final word. Don't bother the navigator about it again, and it'll get done sooner rather than later.
Seriously, the waiting is...
We've spotted Morganas off the port stern, Captain!
Praise the gods, something to distract me. Come on, Captain, let's go!
@BATTLE
Yes, these are the results.
And may I see them?
So patient all of a sudden?
Believe me, I'm holding on by the skin of my teeth here.
All right, here you go. Want to explain them to you?
What am I, an idiot? All right, so... um... yes, I see now.
Do you?
Not even a little bit.

Fields.MenuText: So you're saying you're not quite smart enough to understand, then?
Ha, I knew you'd need help.
Don't worry, I had to have the navigator explain some of this to me as well.

Fields.DialogueText: If you're waiting for me to kowtow, keep waiting, Captain.
Nobody's perfect, right, Captain?
You know, that actually makes me feel better.
Let's start by looking at the graphs. What this shows here is that...
We're receiving a call for help over the radio, Captain. Possible Morganas inbound.
Help first, charts second.
Agreed. My favorite kind of target practice...
@BATTLE
So does that make sense now?
For the most part, but I'm still not sure I understand why my numbers spike in the middle of each of these three tests.
That had me for a while, too. Can you guess what was happening then?
Um, I was firing rounds at buoys?
Without the sarcasm.
You think that was sarcasm?

Fields.MenuText: Well, it certainly wasn't the sound of a serious warrior.
That sarcasm was just like the Command's coffee. Weak.
You think that was helpful?

Fields.DialogueText: You're right, Captain. I suppose that was unbecoming.
You're really going to try and joke your way out of this?
... No, no I do not.
Just try to think of what was happening during the middle of each test.
All right, all right. Hmm... we shot, I reloaded, shot, and reloaded. Adjusted direction. Then you added more dry ice and water, and I shot some more...
Can you identify the one thing out of your control there?
What, the dry ice and water reload?
That. What's so special about that?
Morgana sightings confirmed. Enemy inbound, Captain!
We'll get back to this later. Let's go!
@BATTLE
So you think the addition of more water and dry ice has something to do with my shots dropping?
I don't think that. The numbers say it.
Numbers can be misread, Captain.
Perhaps so, but these don't lie. Your percentages drop when the mixture was reinvigorated.
I just... it doesn't make sense.

Fields.MenuText: And that's why we need to think on this for a bit.
Complaining isn't helping, you know.
I know, I know, and I'm sorry this is all I have to bring to you.

Fields.DialogueText: How about you think - and I'll act?
Then maybe you should just do this!
So how about you just take it back?
It doesn't work that way. We have to be in this together.
Doesn't mean we have to like it.
No, no, it doesn't. Let's...
Captain to the bridge. Enemy sighted!
Maybe some good old-fashioned battle will help clear your mind.
Usually does!
@BATTLE
There was something different about that last fight in the mist, wasn't there?
I felt it, too!
Now what we need to do is parse out what happened last fight with the numbers we already have...
Captain.
Yes? I mean, yes, Achilles?
You faded out for a moment there. Everything all right?

Fields.MenuText: Of course. It's just good to have my teeth in a problem like this again.
Of course. I just hate when things don't match up like this.
More or less. Sometimes I just wish I had the answers, you know?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, it's good to see someone enjoying themselves.
You and me both, Captain.
No, that'd be too easy, right?
As you say, Achilles. Now, about these spikes...
All hands on deck, all hands on deck!
Well, look at it this way. The more battles we're in, the closer we're likely to get to an answer.
Couldn't agree more.
@BATTLE
No, no, move that one there.
Who are you, my mother?
No, I'm your captain, remember?
And if I ever forgot, your shiny little shoulder pins would remind me, wouldn't they?

Fields.MenuText: Is that jealousy I smell?
That and the fact that everyone calls me Captain.
Where did you learn to be so difficult?

Fields.DialogueText: I showered just this morning. Some of the men should follow suit.
Only because that's what your mama named you.
You, all right? I learned it from watching you!
High marks in the comeback, but low marks for the delivery.
Think so? I practiced them all day.
Well, that was fun, but back to...
Morganas spotted!
...the bridge?
My thoughts exactly.
@BATTLE
Achilles, I think I have it!
Is it spreading? Have you tried the cream yet?
Ugh... no, I mean the answer. To the mist question, remember?
Really? Tell me! Tell me!

Fields.MenuText: Well, it's like this. The reason you're so bad in the mist is...
Well, it's like this. Your problem is that...
Well, it's like this. I wouldn't say you're scared in the mist, but...

Fields.DialogueText: Right, hang on. Would you really use the word "bad" to describe this?
Hang on. The word "problem" seems a bit drastic, wouldn't you say?
Hold on there - who's saying I'm scared of anything?
Perhaps I should rephrase?
Perhaps you should!
Don't let this bog you down, Achilles. It's kind of important, remember?
Aye, Captain. Do go on.
Radio intercepts indicate Morgana movement, Captain.
ALWAYS with the interruptions!
Come on then, Achilles. Sooner begun, sooner done.
@BATTLE
Should take your mind off the rash, too.
I said I don't - ugh. Never mind.
All right, think you can explain the... er... issue now?
With surprising ease. We figure that since Belles and Morganas arrived at roughly the same time, there should be some type of link, right?
Assume for the moment there is. Go on.
If that's so, then I believe the issue with your shot percentage has to do with the fears of your moment of birth, as it were.
I'm sorry, are you seriously saying that something that happened to me when I was formed actually has carried down to the present?

Fields.MenuText: Sounds crazy, right?
Yep, that's about it.
I mean, when you say it like that... no, my theory still holds.

Fields.DialogueText: Uh, yeah, crazy.
So, you're really sticking to this idea?
This better be good.
It's serious, I promise. Listen, do you remember how you said your shot problems had to do with your head? This is part of that.
I hope you can figure out a safe way to compare my head to those of the Morganas.
If you'd drop your hostility for a few moments and actually listen to me...
General quarters, general quarters!
Perhaps I'll just go clear my mind with a few headshots, eh? Excuse me.
@BATTLE
Ready for the explanation?
As ready as I'll be.
Here goes. You have no trouble shooting from clean water into Morgana mist, and you have no trouble shooting from within Morgana mist at other targets in the mist, yes?
So far so good.
Your trouble comes from shooting from within the mist at targets outside. Since we know your sight's fine, we know it has to be something else. You've identified your thinking, your head.
All things we knew so far.
But what we didn't think of is how the mists affect you. That's where our tests struck gold.
Meaning what, exactly?

Fields.MenuText: Before I continue... how are you feeling?
Look, just remember not to kill the messenger, all right?
Do me a favor and recall that this isn't my fault, all right?

Fields.DialogueText: Angrier by the minute. Get to the point!
I'm going to have to kill something soon!
What, the torturous waiting? No, that's completely your fault!
What I'm trying to say is...
Morganas sighted!
Hell and damnation!
@BATTLE
Achilles, are you calm?
Calm enough. Finish the explanation.
Put shortly, the mist creeps you out, and the creepiness of the mist affects you just enough that you pull your shots slightly wide.
But only while in the mist shooting out.
Exactly.
Why?
Does it matter?
Of course it matters!

Fields.MenuText: Really? I thought winning mattered.
Really? I didn't think you'd care so long as you could get better.
Really? Hmm, that's interesting. I never thought you'd care about the why.

Fields.DialogueText: It does. I mean... no, it does!
I do want to get better, I do!
Well... put like that, I guess I don't.
If improvement is what matters, we need to figure out a way to reduce the creepiness.
That's it? That's all you've gotten from your numbers and figures?
That's all I need. I figured it'd be best to talk quickly since every time I bring this up, we...
Captain and Achilles to the bridge. Er... please don't yell at me, Achilles...
You see, now you've gone and frightened our personnel.
I'll make amends later. Killing first.
@BATTLE
I've decided that I don't care, Captain.
Bit more specific, Achilles.
I don't care about my shot percentage. It doesn't matter.
Oh? That's a surprise.
Try not to let it harm you.
Well, if it makes any difference at all, I think you're lying.
You what?
You can't seriously expect me to believe that you're not at all interested in being the best, not after we've known each other this long.
Well, I...

Fields.MenuText: You can try to fool me, Achilles, but you can't fool yourself.
Lying is a sin, Achilles. Don't try to pull me down, too.
Not caring is one thing, but pretending to not care is something entirely different.

Fields.DialogueText: I... damn it, Captain. I suppose I should be flattered you've learned so much from me.
Don't speak to me about... oh, who am I kidding? You're right.
It isn't that I don't care... er, don't want to seem... er...
Let's just move on to the important thing. You have a problem, I think I have a solution, and you have to be willing to trust me.
I do, Captain, implicitly.
Hopefully you mean explicitly.
Perfectly?
Yes, go with that one.
@BATTLE
Words, words, words. At least with Morganas I can just shoot.
Do that.
So... this great idea of yours?
It is rather great, if I do say so myself.
I thought I was the one with humility issues.
No, you're the one with creepy Morgana mist issues.
Captain, you promised you wouldn't make fun of this. I feel weird enough as it is just knowing about it myself.
Confronting the issue is half the battle. The other half involves this.
What, a scarf?
No, a blindfold.
You can't seriously expect me to wear that, can you?

Fields.MenuText: I can, I do, and you will.
Only if you want to improve.
Since when did you become so scared about everything?

Fields.DialogueText: Fine, all right, and... ugh. If you say so.
The things I do for this ship and my crew... .
I'm not scared of anything! Here, give me that thing.
Now you won't need to wear this until...
Morganas inbound! Mist rising!
Well, now, actually. Here, put this on. I'll explain as we go.
@BATTLE
That was without a doubt the strangest thing I've ever done.
Just wait until next time.
There's going to be a next time?
Achilles, do you want to know what happened to your shot percentage while shooting out from Morgana mist into clear air while wearing that blindfold?
Um, it dropped? A lot?
The difference between your problem shots and regular shots halved.
After one session? Sign me up for more!

Fields.MenuText: That's the spirit! Experiment till we get it right!
That's the spirit! Focus on the good, and ignore the strange!
That's the spirit! Never flee, never fail! I'm proud of you, Achilles!

Fields.DialogueText: I... wait... what? I'm an experiment now?
Good, yes... um... what strange?
Who said anything about fleeing?
The important thing is that it worked.
Agreed... but I'd still like to know why.
Let's get it solidified and then I can explain, all right?
Very well, Captain, I trust your judgement.
@BATTLE
You wouldn't have picked me if you didn't. Come on - let's fight these monsters for a breather.
Another engagement, another success. Here's your record from the last one.
My shots went up again! Mist be damned... maybe I should wear a blindfold in all my engagements.
No, that would just screw things up. Trust me.
All right, but you still haven't explained why this works.
Give me one more data point, Achilles. Then I'll explain everything.
What's a data point?

Fields.MenuText: It's just a fact, ma'am.
Well, you see, when two words really like spending time with each other, they...
I don't know! What's the point to anything in this crazy world?

Fields.DialogueText: Oooooh! All right then, you're being a bit weird.
Ugh. Never mind, never mind!
Victory, of course!
Ahead full. Morganas sighted!
Let's get this one under our belt, and I should have enough to answer your questions.
The sooner the better. Let's go!
@BATTLE
Remember how I told you I thought the Belles and the Morganas are connected in some way?
Yes, and I'm still angry at the comparison.
Don't be. It's what I needed to figure this out.
Oh, finally. The explanation.
I'm ignoring that. What I want you to do is imagine that you're afraid of spiders.
But I'm not.
Hence the word imagine. Now, Imagine you're afraid of spiders. You walk into a room and see a spider hiding in the corner. What do you do?
Squish it.
No, it... You're afraid of spiders, remember?
I am not. I just told you I wasn't, remember?

Fields.MenuText: For the love of... will you just play along?
Can you for once just suspend disbelief and work with me on this?
You're right, you're not. Just act like you are for two seconds.

Fields.DialogueText: All right, all right... I'm afraid of spiders. Go.
Fine, have it your way. Let's pretend I'm afraid of spiders.
All right, all right... but only the venomous ones.
Good. Now, you walk into a room... afraid of spiders... and what would be there but a giant spider. What do you do?
Er... if I was afraid of spiders, I'd probably leave the room quickly.
Exactly. Now, pretend you're afraid of spiders and you enter a room with one in it, only you don't see it. What do you do?
Um... nothing?
Exactly!
Wait, so how...
General quarters, general quarters, all hands to action stations!
We'll pick this up later, I promise!
@BATTLE
When have I ever been content to do nothing...?
So remember, spiders, room, fear, all that good stuff.
Right. So why is me doing nothing a good thing if I'm afraid of spiders and stuck in a room with one?
Only you don't know it's there.
And I don't know it's there.
If you can't see something, odds are you can't be affected by your fear of it. In this case...
Since I can't see the mist, I can't let it get to me?
Precisely.
Captain, that's...

Fields.MenuText: Genius? Thanks, I know.
Brilliant? Yep, that's me for sure.
Lucky, I suppose. Better that than dead.

Fields.DialogueText: I was going to say amazing, but we'll go with genius.
Sounds like someone needs a heap of humility to go with their plate of brilliance.
No, it was much more than luck. Don't kid yourself.
Well, now that that's over, we can start working on your unease by acclimating you to it.
Why bother?
I'm sorry?
Captain, if it isn't broke, don't fix it. Give me that blindfold... I mean, may I please have it?
Of course, but what are you going to...
I'm going to keep it and use it every time I feel nervous. Now that you've shown me where my angst comes from, I'm ready to battle it. Thank you, Captain.
Hey, what are friends for if not helping each other out? You're welcome.
@BATTLE
